Message.Text: Tommy, we really need to consider using NoSQL for our project. It handles unstructured data so much better than SQL!
NoSQL is great for certain scenarios, Frank, but you can't deny that SQL offers structure and consistency, which we need in our project!
Sure, SQL has its benefits, but what about scalability? NoSQL outperforms SQL when it comes to handling large datasets!
Scalability? That's your argument? SQL databases can scale too, and they offer ACID compliance, which is crucial for reliability!
ACID compliance is overrated in modern applications. We need flexibility and speed, not your rigid structures!
Flexibility without structure leads to chaos, Frank! We need to maintain some order if we want this project to succeed!
Order? More like stagnation! NoSQL allows us to innovate without being held back by outdated schemas!
Outdated? Come on! SQL has stood the test of time for a reason. You can't just throw that away for the sake of being trendy!
Trendy? No, Tommy, it's called progress! If we don't adapt, we’ll be left behind while others embrace the future!
And if we embrace chaos instead? We’ll regret not sticking with a tried-and-true solution!
